definition: to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House

sentences.english: While we, when making a choice, are so full of hesitations and have so many doubts.
sentences.chinese: 而人们在做出种种选择的时候总会参杂着诸多的犹豫。

sentences.english: There is a mixture of truth competing with mal-intentioned-lobbyist-backed misinformation.
sentences.chinese: 真相中会参杂着恶意游说支持误传。

sentences.english: Do you think costume piece has mixed too much modern character?
sentences.chinese: 古装剧是否该参杂过多的现代元素呢？

sentences.english: It’s a flat piece of doped silicon.
sentences.chinese: 它其实就是一块参杂了硅元素的扁平材料。

sentences.english: Knowledge which is acquired in the ordinary state of consciousness, is intermixed with dreams.
sentences.chinese: 在一般意识状态下所获得的知识，会有梦想参杂其中。

sentences.english: The small amount of blood mixed into the stool is usually not visible to the naked eye.
sentences.chinese: 粪便中参杂的少量血液仅凭肉眼是无法看到的。

sentences.english: If you must correct someone, don't get personal about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你一定要指正某人，不要参杂个人因素。

sentences.english: Her black hair was dusted with gray hairs.
sentences.chinese: 她的黑发里参杂着白发。

sentences.english: To somehow plug into that place where only logic applies, and emotion is irrelevant.
sentences.chinese: 以某种方式，只用逻辑，不参杂情感。

sentences.english: It's a flat piece of doped silicon.
sentences.chinese: 它实在就是一块参杂了硅元素的扁平材料。

sentences.english: The cold-pressing ceramic processing technique was used to prepare Ce-doped Barium Titanate ceramics.
sentences.chinese: 采用冷压陶瓷处理技术制备了铈参杂的铁酸钡陶瓷。

sentences.english: One time, when he came back and visited, I noticed that he would mix in some English vocab when he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 有一次他回到台湾，听他讲话都会参杂一些英文单字。

sentences.english: Financial markets shrugged off the mixed batch of economic news.
sentences.chinese: 金融市场没有太在意好坏参杂的经济消息。

sentences.english: Marry do not go out, mostly is mixed all sorts of disturbing factors.
sentences.chinese: 嫁不出去的，大多都是参杂种种恼人的因素的。

definition: to mix together (disparate substances)/to mingle/a mix/to be tangled up with
to carry within it/to be mixed in/to slip sth in/to intersperse/(hydrology etc) to entrain/to smuggle/notes smuggled into an exam
to be full of/to flood/to congest
to contain in a concealed form/to keep covered up/implicit
mix together/put together (usu. things that do not blend well together)
to be full of (emotion)/to brim with (love, tears etc)
